SENT.plain: Cardiac tumours in infancy are rare and are mostly benign with rhabdomyomas, fibromas and teratomas accounting for the majority
The presentation depends on size and location of the mass as they tend to cause cavity obstruction or arrhythmias
Most rhabdomyomas tend to regress spontaneously but fibromas and teratomas generally require surgical intervention for severe haemodynamic or arrhythmic complications
Other relatively rare cardiac tumours too are discussed along with an Indian perspective
